item.title: Ginny add a quote by Richard Adams
item.description: "Then El-ahrairah knew that Frith was too clever for him and he was frightened. He thought that the fox and the weasel were coming with Frith and he turned to the face of the hill and begin to dig. He dug a hole, but he had dug only a little of it when Frith came over the hill alone. And he saw El-ahrairah's bottom sticking out of the hole and the sand flying out in showers as the digging went on. When he saw that, he called out, 'My friend, have you seen El-ahrairah, for I am looking for him to give him my gift?' 'No,' answered El-ahrairah, without coming out, 'I have not seen him. He is far away. He could not come.' So Frith said, 'Then come out of that hole and I will bless you instead of him.' 'No, I cannot,' said El-ahrairah, 'I am busy. The fox and the weasel are coming. If you want to bless me you can bless my bottom, for it is sticking out of the hole." -- Richard Adams

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Ginny add a quote by William Shakespeare
Ginny add a quote by Robert W. Service
item.description: "A promise made is a debt unpaid" -- Robert W. Service

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Ginny add a quote by Tom Clancy
item.description: "The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense." -- Tom Clancy
